section.name: Tomcat Configuration
section.p: Jetspeed 2 can use the Tomcat Manager application for managing portlet applications with the Portlet Application Lifecycle Manager Portlet (PALM). To be able to do so it needs a configured Tomcat user with the predefined 'manager' role in the ${org.apache.jetspeed.server.home}/conf/tomcat-users.xml.

A minimal example tomcat-users.xml can look like:
<tomcat-users> <role rolename="manager"/> <user username="j2deployer" password="xxxxx" roles="manager"/> </tomcat-users>
The attribute values for username and password must correspond to the specified values for
${org.apache.jetspeed.services.autodeployment.user}
and
${org.apache.jetspeed.services.autodeployment.user}
as described above.

section.name: Tomcat 5.5.9 on Windows
section.p: To have redeployment and undeployment working properly when using Tomcat 5.5.9 on Windows you have to set the global Context attribute "antiJARLocking" to true.
